title: Bodegas Caro 2014 Amancaya Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Root beer and berry aromas announce a wine that's less than fresh. A Cabernet-Malbec blend, it's ripe and heavy, with concentrated, raisiny cassis flavors. Additional notes of coffee and toast are most prominent on the finish.

title: Corte Giara 2015 La Groletta  (Valpolicella Ripasso)
description: Opening aromas convey raisin, cocoa, a hint of bell pepper and earthy whiff of game. The firm palate shows fig, cassis and dried sage alongside tightly wound tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Croma Vera 2015 Revelacion Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dried rose petals, concentrated red cherry, anise, thyme and caramel show on the nose of this blend of Tempranillo, Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah. The palate is dominated by a rustic sagebrush quality, with earthy red berry and crushed slate adding pleasant complexity.

title: Carlton Cellars 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: The best of the winery's current release white wines, this offers fresh and well-defined apple and tart melon flavors. It seems to have spent some time in barrel, but the acidity balances the oak flavors well.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Melon aromas of honeydew and cantaloupe meet with crisp stone fruit and Key lime pie on the nose of this bottling. There is a chalky grip to the sip, with mellow flavors of Meyer lemon juice and Asian pear.

title: Domaine Julie Belland 2015 Charmes  (Santenay)
description: Run by the sixth generation of the Belland family, this estate has vines in Santenay and other Côte de Beaune appellations. This wine, rich with generous red cherry fruits, is lightly tannic with great swathes of acidity and fruitiness. Drink from 2019.

title: Durigutti 2015 Red (Mendoza)
description: Full-blast mocha, blackberry and cassis aromas announce a fruity, extracted red. Its pulpy palate has bold, candied black fruit flavors that end rather quickly.

title: Familia Schroeder 2015 Alto Limay Pinot Noir (Patagonia)
description: Dry red berry aromas and spicy oak notes make for a good opening in this wine. It's a bit creamy in texture, with commendable overall balance. It offers ripe raspberry and cassis flavors, with a touch of milk chocolate on the smooth finish.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Thick and moderate in structure, this wine is fleshy, lush and tropical in nature. Swirled in butterscotch, vanilla and caramel, the oak is toasty and supportive.

title: Firesteed 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This is fresh and lively, with apple and pear fruit flavors. It's simple, clean and enjoyable, with a light dusting of cinnamon spice. The vineyard sources included Rickreall Estate and Erratic Oaks.

title: Frankland Estate 2016 Poison Hill Riesling (Frankland River)
description: More steely than the Isolation Ridge, the nose offers plenty of floral notes combined with pineapple, stone fruit, apple and yeast. This leads into a tightly wound yet fruity palate, with crushed stone and a poise and structure that sets this up for plenty of years of cellaring. Drink 2019–2032.

title: Frankland Estate 2017 Riesling (Frankland River)
description: Intensely perfumed, this wine is full of peachy soap and potpourri, along with passionfruit notes and a hint of spice. The bombastic fruit and floral notes continue on the palate which is balanced and light bodied. Drink now.

title: Franz Keller 2016 vom Löss Pinot Gris (Baden)
description: Sunny tangerines and lemons abound in this full-bodied dry Pinot Gris. Yielding acidity and plump fruit amplifies its rich, rolling mouthfeel. While moderately concentrated on the palate, it's a pleasant, easygoing sip with wide appeal.

title: Goodfellow 2015 Fir Crest Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A recent addition to the winery's single vineyard offerings, this has a strongly acidic profile, but the fruit suggests cherry rather than leaner berry flavors. The tannins are stiff and astringent—a result of 50% whole cluster fermentation.

title: Goose Ridge 2015 Cellar Select Artist Series Estate Bottled Reserve Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine's aroma brings notes of vanilla, woodspice and baking spice in addition to its bright tangerine scents. The palate is elegant yet creamy in feel, with stone fruit and barrel flavors throughout. It pulls up a bit short on the finish but is otherwise a lovely wine.
designation: Cellar Select Artist Series Estate Bottled Reserve

title: Hard Row To Hoe 2014 Pinot Noir (Lake Chelan)
description: This wine was sourced from Clos CheValle Vineyard. It shows primary fruit aromas that bring a lightly candied quality and herbal accents. The palate is a bit clunky, losing some of the variety's delicacy but still delivering enjoyment.

title: Hentley Farm 2014 The Beauty Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: Very shy at first, this wine eventually shows dark raisiny fruit, vanilla and toasty oak. There's plenty of richness and heat, that meld with grainy, tightly wound tannins and plush fruit.

title: Jacob's Creek 2015 Steingarten Riesling (Barossa)
description: Ripe stone fruit, lemon-lime popsicle and blossoms lead into a palate of crisp acidity. Acid hounds will dig this fairly simple but likable drop.

title: Kavaklidere 2013 Côtes d'Avanos White (Cappadocia)
description: Medium gold in color, this wine has aromas of pear and talc. It is slightly off-dry, offering flavors of pear, gala apple, toffee and apricot, with a soft mouthfeel and a light, floral finish.

title: Longship 2015 Invader Tempranillo (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine's vanilla and herb aromas are high toned. The palate brings abundant fruit and barrel flavors, with lively acidity providing the frame. The tannins seem a little coarse at present. Give them some time to settle.

title: Maison Matisco 2016  Saint-Véran
description: This wine is well balanced, with ripe apricot and peach fruits that contrast with the crisp, tangy lemon. Together they give a wine that is juicy and bright while also full bodied and rich. Drink from 2018.

title: Manimurci 2016 Nepente  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: Aromas of citrus, pineapple and orchard fruit lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the fresh palate along with green apple, lime and an almond note. It finishes with a hint of acacia honey and a saline note.

title: Marqués de Valparaíso 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of rose petals and raisins carry to a compact palate that is chewy and tannic. Blocky plum and berry flavors are slightly flat on a finish with scraping tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Maryhill 2014 Elephant Mountain Vineyards Mourvèdre (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: This 100% varietal wine shows high-toned baking spice and red fruit aromas that lead to ripe but well-proportioned cherry and meat flavors. Fruit and barrel notes interweave on the finish.

title: Milestii Mici 2003 Cabernet Sauvignon (Moldova)
description: This Moldovan Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of smoked meats and black fruits. In the mouth it is pleasantly astringent, with flavors of tart cherry and blackberry.

title: Montserrat Canals Torres 2014 Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: A fresh nose with a whiff of briny apple sets up a palate of green pear and crushed stone. Lime and apple flavors are lasting and pure across the crisp finish.

title: Nicolis 2016  Valpolicella Classico
description: Aromas of red-skinned berry and graphite lift out of the glass. It's savory, doling out raspberry jam, clove and a touch of cinnamon alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2016  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: This wine is juicy and crisp, with bright red-currant and cherry fruitiness. The fruit dominates, with plenty of acidity and a core of tannins to support it. It should be ready to drink from 2022.

title: Roco 2015 Ancient Waters Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This blend was made to showcase grapes from a variety of ancient soils. The new vintage lacks the concentration of the 2014 but still expresses mild hints of rock, slate and shell under soft plum, cocoa and toasted grain flavors.

title: San Cassiano 2012 Le Alene  (Valpolicella Superiore)
description: Underbrush, game and black-plum aromas lead the way. On the earthy palate, close-grained tannins support prune, vanilla and tobacco. Drink through 2022.
